title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing othersâ€™ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official email address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement danvartan@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozillaâ€™s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to brandr
text: Think brandr useful? Let others discover , telling person, via Twitter blog post. Using brandr paper writing? Consider citing .

text: idea new brandr feature? Take look documentation [issue list][issue] see isnâ€™t included suggested yet. , suggest idea [issue GitHub][issue]. canâ€™t promise implement idea, helps : Explain detail work Keep scope narrow possible See want contribute code idea well.

title: Contributing to brandr
text: Using brandr discovered bug? â€™s annoying! Donâ€™t let others experience report issue GitHub can fix . good bug report makes easier us , please include: content utils::sessionInfo(). details local setup might helpful troubleshooting. Detailed steps reproduce bug (Tip: use reprex package).

text: Noticed typo website? Think function use better example? Good documentation makes difference, help improve welcome!

title: Contributing to brandr
text: try follow GitHub flow development. Fork repo clone computer. learn process, see guide. forked cloned project since worked , pull changes original repo clone using git pull upstream main Open project RStudio IDE choice Write code Test code (Bonus points adding unit tests) Document code (See function documentation ) Check code devtools::check() aim 0 errors, warnings notes Commit push changes Submit pull request Also note use tidyverse design guide tidyverse style guide. code must conform principles rules.

title: Brand Identity Management Using brand.yml Standard
text: ðŸ‘ï¸ðŸŽ¨ðŸŒˆðŸ” ðŸ†ŽðŸ” ðŸ”¡ðŸ”¤ðŸ“âœ’ï¸ðŸ–‹ï¸ðŸ–Œï¸ðŸ–ï¸ðŸ’­ðŸ“¢ðŸŽ¯ðŸ’¡ðŸ“±ðŸ–¥ï¸ðŸ–¨ï¸ðŸŽªðŸŽ­ðŸš€ðŸ’¼âœ¨ðŸŒŸ brandr R package designed facilitate brand identity management using brand.yml standard, providing functions consistently access apply brand colors, typography, visual elements across R projects. Please note brandr affiliated Posit.

title: Brand Identity Management Using brand.yml Standard
text: can install brandr using remotes package:
code: remotes::install_github("danielvartan/brandr")

title: Brand Identity Management Using brand.yml Standard
text: brandr equipped several functions help use _brand.yml file. Like: color_brand_sequential(), color_brand_diverging(), color_brand_qualitative(): Brand color functions scale_brand(), scale_color_brand_d(), scale_color_brand_c(), scale_color_brand_b(), scale_fill_brand_d(), scale_fill_brand_c(), scale_fill_brand_b(): ggplot2 scales brand colors interpolate_colors(): Interpolate colors get_brand_color(): Get brand color name get_brand_color_tint(): Get brand color tint name get_brand_color_mix(): Get mix brand colors get_brand_font(): Get brand font name Example:
code: get_brand_color(c("primary", "red", "dark")) [1] "#DA4E3C" "#DA4E3C" "#35131F"

title: Brand Identity Management Using brand.yml Standard
text: brandr code released MIT license.

title: Brand Identity Management Using brand.yml Standard
text: welcome contributions, including bug reports. Take moment review Guidelines Contributing.  Become brandr supporter! Click make donation. Please indicate brandr package donation message.

what: brandr: Brand Identity Management Using brand.yml Standard â€” brandr-package
title: brandr: Brand Identity Management Using brand.yml Standard â€” brandr-package
text: Facilitate brand identity management using 'brand.yml' standard, providing functions consistently access apply brand colors, typography, visual elements across R projects.

title: brandr: Brand Identity Management Using brand.yml Standard â€” brandr-package
text: Maintainer: Daniel Vartanian danvartan@gmail.com (ORCID) [conceptor, copyright holder]

title: Brand color functions â€” color_brand_sequential
text: color_brand_* functions wrappers interpolate_colors() sequential, diverging, qualitative brand color scales. serve facilitators visualization colors used brand scale.

title: Brand color functions â€” color_brand_sequential
code: color_brand_sequential(n, direction = 1)  color_brand_diverging(n, direction = 1)  color_brand_qualitative(n, direction = 1)

title: Brand color functions â€” color_brand_sequential
text: n parameter accepts two types inputs: value integer number type seq div, function return discrete color spectrum n colors. value integer number type qual, function return n colors colors parameter, order, repeating , necessary. value numeric vector 0 1, function return color positions n considering continuous color spectrum ranging 0 1. direction (Optional) Sets order colors scale. 1 colors output palette function. -1, order colors reversed (Default: 1).

title: Brand color functions â€” color_brand_sequential
text: character vector hexadecimal color codes.

title: Brand color functions â€” color_brand_sequential
text: control colors brand color scale, assign desired hexadecimal color codes character vector following options: BRANDR_COLOR_SEQUENTIAL sequential color scales BRANDR_COLOR_DIVERGING diverging color scales BRANDR_COLOR_QUALITATIVE qualitative color scales Use get_brand_color() get hexadecimal color codes _brand.yml file. Example:
code: options(   BRANDR_COLOR_SEQUENTIAL =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "secondary")),   BRANDR_COLOR_DIVERGING =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "white", "secondary")),   BRANDR_COLOR_QUALITATIVE =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "secondary", "tertiary")) )

title: Brand color functions â€” color_brand_sequential
code: if (interactive()) {   color_brand_sequential(5)   color_brand_diverging(5)   color_brand_qualitative(5) }

title: Get brand colors â€” get_brand_color
text: get_brand_color() retrieves hexadecimal color codes _brand.yml file.

title: Get brand colors â€” get_brand_color
code: get_brand_color(color, brand_yml = here::here("_brand.yml"))

title: Get brand colors â€” get_brand_color
text: color character vector indicating name colors present color section _brand.yml file. brand_yml (Optional) character string indicating path _brand.yml file. provided, function look _brand.yml file current working directory.

title: Get brand colors â€” get_brand_color
text: character vector hexadecimal color codes.

title: Get brand colors â€” get_brand_color
code: if (interactive()) {   get_brand_color("primary")   get_brand_color("secondary")   get_brand_color("tertiary")    get_brand_color(c("primary", "secondary"))   get_brand_color(c("red", "green", "blue")) }

what: Get a mix of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_mix
title: Get a mix of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_mix
text: get_brand_color_mix() mixes two specific brand colors.

title: Get a mix of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_mix
code: get_brand_color_mix(   position = 500,   color_1 = "primary",   color_2 = "secondary",   alpha = 0.5,   brand_yml = here::here("_brand.yml") )

title: Get a mix of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_mix
text: position (Optional) numeric vector indicating position brand color range tints. range positions 0 1000 (Default: 500). color_1, color_2 character string indicating name color present color section _brand.yml file. alpha number 0 1 indicating alpha transparency color mix (Default: 0.5). brand_yml (Optional) character string indicating path _brand.yml file. provided, function look _brand.yml file current working directory.

title: Get a mix of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_mix
text: character vector hexadecimal color codes.

title: Get a mix of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_mix
code: if (interactive()) {   get_brand_color_mix(     position = 500,     color_1 = "primary",     color_2 = "secondary",     alpha = 0.5   ) }

what: Get tints of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_tint
title: Get tints of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_tint
text: get_brand_color_tint() generates range tints (color variations) specific brand color, black (position 0) brand color (position 500) white (position 1000), returns hexadecimal color code specified position.

title: Get tints of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_tint
code: get_brand_color_tint(   position = 500,   color = "primary",   brand_yml = here::here("_brand.yml") )

title: Get tints of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_tint
text: position (Optional) numeric vector indicating position brand color range tints. range positions 0 1000 (Default: 500). color character string indicating name color present color section _brand.yml file (Default: "primary"). brand_yml (Optional) character string indicating path _brand.yml file. provided, function look _brand.yml file current working directory.

title: Get tints of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_tint
text: character vector hexadecimal color codes.

title: Get tints of brand colors â€” get_brand_color_tint
code: if (interactive()) {   seq(0, 1000, 250)   #> [1] 0  250  500  750 1000 # Expected    get_brand_color_tint(seq(0, 1000, 250), color = "primary")   #> [1] "#000000" "#6D271E" "#DA4E3C" "#ECA69D" "#FFFFFF" # Expected }

title: Get brand fonts/typefaces â€” get_brand_font
text: get_brand_font() retrieves names fonts/typefaces _brand.yml file.

title: Get brand fonts/typefaces â€” get_brand_font
code: get_brand_font(font, brand_yml = here::here("_brand.yml"))

title: Get brand fonts/typefaces â€” get_brand_font
text: font character vector indicating name fonts/typefaces categories present typography section _brand.yml file. brand_yml (Optional) character string indicating path _brand.yml file. provided, function look _brand.yml file current working directory.

title: Get brand fonts/typefaces â€” get_brand_font
text: character vector fonts/typeface names.

title: Get brand fonts/typefaces â€” get_brand_font
code: if (interactive()) {   get_brand_font("base")   get_brand_font("headings")   get_brand_font("monospace")   get_brand_font("monospace-inline")   get_brand_font("monospace-block")    get_brand_font(c("base", "headings")) }

title: Interpolate colors â€” interpolate_colors
text: interpolate_colors() interpolate colors sequential, diverging, qualitative color scales.

title: Interpolate colors â€” interpolate_colors
code: interpolate_colors(   n,   colors = getOption("BRANDR_COLOR_SEQUENTIAL"),   type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )

title: Interpolate colors â€” interpolate_colors
text: n parameter accepts two types inputs: value integer number type seq div, function return discrete color spectrum n colors. value integer number type qual, function return n colors colors parameter, order, repeating , necessary. value numeric vector 0 1, function return color positions n considering continuous color spectrum ranging 0 1. colors (Optional) character vector colors use scale. NULL, brandr try choose colors based type argument. type (Optional) character string indicating type color scale: "seq"/"sequential"``, "div"/"diverging"â€œ, "qual"/`"qualitative"` (Default: `c `). direction (Optional) Sets order colors scale. 1 colors output palette function. -1, order colors reversed (Default: 1). ... Additional arguments passed colorRampPalette() creating color ramp. valid type seq div.

title: Interpolate colors â€” interpolate_colors
text: character vector hexadecimal color codes.

title: Interpolate colors â€” interpolate_colors
text: control colors brand color scale, assign desired hexadecimal color codes character vector following options: BRANDR_COLOR_SEQUENTIAL sequential color scales BRANDR_COLOR_DIVERGING diverging color scales BRANDR_COLOR_QUALITATIVE qualitative color scales Use get_brand_color() get hexadecimal color codes _brand.yml file. Example:
code: options(   BRANDR_COLOR_SEQUENTIAL =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "secondary")),   BRANDR_COLOR_DIVERGING =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "white", "secondary")),   BRANDR_COLOR_QUALITATIVE =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "secondary", "tertiary")) )

title: Interpolate colors â€” interpolate_colors
code: interpolate_colors(3, color = c("red", "blue"), type = "seq") #> [1] "#FF0000" "#7F007F" "#0000FF"  # Produce the same results when `type = "seq"` interpolate_colors(3, color = c("red", "white", "blue"), type = "div") #> [1] "#FF0000" "#FFFFFF" "#0000FF"  interpolate_colors(3, color = c("red", "blue"), type = "qual") #> [1] "red"  "blue" "red"   interpolate_colors(3, color = c("red", "blue"), type = "seq", direction = -1) #> [1] "#0000FF" "#7F007F" "#FF0000"  interpolate_colors(3, color = c("red", "blue"), type = "seq", bias = 100) #> [1] "#FF0000" "#7F007F" "#0000FF"

what: Brand color scales for `ggplot2â€œ â€” scale_brand
title: Brand color scales for `ggplot2â€œ â€” scale_brand
text: scale_*_brand_*() functions provide color scales ggplot2 based brand colors defined _brand.yml file. functions create discrete, continuous, binned scales sequential, diverging, qualitative color palettes match brand identity.

title: Brand color scales for `ggplot2â€œ â€” scale_brand
code: scale_brand(   aesthetics = "color",   scale_type = "c",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   na.value = NA,   reverse = FALSE,   brand_yml = here::here("_brand.yml"),   ... )  scale_color_brand_d(   aesthetics = "color",   scale_type = "d",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )  scale_color_brand_c(   aesthetics = "color",   scale_type = "c",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )  scale_color_brand_b(   aesthetics = "color",   scale_type = "b",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )  scale_colour_brand_d(   aesthetics = "color",   scale_type = "d",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )  scale_colour_brand_c(   aesthetics = "color",   scale_type = "c",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )  scale_colour_brand_b(   aesthetics = "color",   scale_type = "b",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )  scale_fill_brand_d(   aesthetics = "fill",   scale_type = "d",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )  scale_fill_brand_c(   aesthetics = "fill",   scale_type = "c",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )  scale_fill_brand_b(   aesthetics = "fill",   scale_type = "b",   color_type = "seq",   direction = 1,   ... )

title: Brand color scales for `ggplot2â€œ â€” scale_brand
text: aesthetics (Optional) character string indicating name aesthetic scale (e.g., "color"``, "fill"`). scale_type (Optional) character string indicating type scale: "d"/"discrete", "c"/"continuous", "b"/"binned". color_type (Optional) character string indicating type color scale: "seq"/"sequential"``, "div"/"diverging"â€œ, "qual"/`"qualitative"` (Default: `c `). direction (Optional) Sets order colors scale. 1 colors output palette function. -1, order colors reversed (Default: 1). na.value (Optional) character string indicating color use missing values. must contain hexadecimal color code one values colors() (Default: NA). reverse logical indicating whether legend color bar reversed (Default: FALSE). brand_yml (Optional) character string indicating path _brand.yml file. provided, function look _brand.yml file current working directory. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2 scale function: discrete_scale(), continuous_scale(), binned_scale().

title: Brand color scales for `ggplot2â€œ â€” scale_brand
text: ggplot2 scale object.

title: Brand color scales for `ggplot2â€œ â€” scale_brand
text: control colors brand color scale, assign desired hexadecimal color codes character vector following options: BRANDR_COLOR_SEQUENTIAL sequential color scales BRANDR_COLOR_DIVERGING diverging color scales BRANDR_COLOR_QUALITATIVE qualitative color scales Use get_brand_color() get hexadecimal color codes _brand.yml file. Example:
code: options(   BRANDR_COLOR_SEQUENTIAL =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "secondary")),   BRANDR_COLOR_DIVERGING =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "white", "secondary")),   BRANDR_COLOR_QUALITATIVE =     get_brand_color(c("primary", "secondary", "tertiary")) )

title: Brand color scales for `ggplot2â€œ â€” scale_brand
code: if (base::interactive()) {   library(ggplot2)    ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = cyl)) +     geom_bar() +     scale_color_brand_c() +     theme_bw()    ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, fill = factor(cyl))) +     geom_boxplot() +     scale_fill_brand_d(color_type = "qual") +     theme_bw() }
